name: Sts. Rusticus and Eleutherius

locations.description: Martyred in Paris with St. Denis

summary: Rusticus and Eleutherius were companions of St. Denis of Paris who were martyred together with him in Paris around 250 AD. According to tradition, they were a priest and a deacon who accompanied Denis on his mission to evangelize Gaul. They were all beheaded together on Montmartre (Mount of Martyrs) in Paris. They are venerated as saints and are often depicted together with St. Denis.
